Minor.name: Assault
Minor.tooltip: To use physical force against someone without the apparent intent to kill them.

Minor.name: Pickpocketting
Minor.tooltip: To steal items from another's person.

Minor.name: Minor Vandalism
Minor.tooltip: To damage, destroy, or permanently deface non-critical furniture, vendors, or personal property.

Minor.name: Vigilantism
Minor.tooltip: To perform the responsibilities and duties of the security department without approval or due cause to act.

Minor.name: Illegal Distribution
Minor.tooltip: The possession of dangerous or illegal drugs/equipment in a quantity greater than that which is reasonable for personal consumption.

Minor.name: Disturbing the Peace
Minor.tooltip: To knowingly organize a movement which disrupts the normal operations of a department.

Minor.name: Negligence
Minor.tooltip: To be negligent in one's duty to an extent that it may cause harm, illness, or other negative effect, to another.

Minor.name: Trespass
Minor.tooltip: To be in an area which a person has either not purposefully been admitted to, does not have access, or has been asked to leave by someone who has access to that area.

Minor.name: Breaking and Entering
Minor.tooltip: To trespass into an area using a method of forcible entry.

Minor.name: Discriminatory Language
Minor.tooltip: To use language which demeans, generalizes, or otherwise de-personafies the individual at which it is targeted.

Minor.name: Fine Evasion
Minor.tooltip: To purposefully avoid or refuse to pay a legal fine.

Minor.name: Religious Activity outside of the chapel
Minor.tooltip: To convert, proselytize, hold rituals or otherwise attempt to act in the name of a religion or deity outside of the chapel.

Misdemeanour.name: Aggravated Assault
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To take physical action against a person with intent to grievously harm, but not to kill.

Misdemeanour.name: Theft
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To steal equipment or items from a workplace, or items of extraordinary value from one's person.

Misdemeanour.name: Major Vandalism
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To destroy or damage non-critical furniture, vendors, or personal property in a manor that can not be repaired.

Misdemeanour.name: Conspiracy
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To knowingly work with another person in the interest of committing an illegal action.

Misdemeanour.name: Hostile Agent
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To knowingly act as a recruiter, representative, messenger, ally, benefactor, or other associate of a hostile organization as defined within Code 405(EOTC).

Misdemeanour.name: Contraband Equipment Possession
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To possess equipment not approved for use or production aboard Nanotrasen stations. This includes equipment produced by The Syndicate, Wizard Federation, or any other hostile organization as defined within Code 405(EOTC).

Misdemeanour.name: Rioting
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To act as a member in a group which collectively commits acts of major vandalism, sabotage, grand sabotage, or other felony crimes.

Misdemeanour.name: High Negligence
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To be negligent in one's duty to an extent that it may cause harm to multiple individuals, a department, or in a manor which directly leads to a serious injury of another person which requires emergency medical treatment.

Misdemeanour.name: Trespass, Inherently Dangerous Areas
Misdemeanour.tooltip: Trespassing in an area which may lead to the injury of self, or others.

Misdemeanour.name: Breaking and Entering, Inherently Dangerous Areas
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To trespass into an area which may lead to the injury of self or others using forcible entry.

Misdemeanour.name: Insubordination
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To knowingly disobey a lawful order from a superior.

Misdemeanour.name: Fraud
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To misrepresent ones intention in the interest of gaining property or money from another individual.

Misdemeanour.name: Genetic Mutilation
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To purposefully modify an individual's genetic code without consent, or with intent to harm.

Major.name: Larceny
Major.tooltip: To steal rare, expensive (Items of greater than 1000 credit value), or restricted equipment from secure areas or one's person.

Major.name: Sabotage
Major.tooltip: To destroy station assets or resources critical to normal or emergency station procedures, or cause sections of the station to become uninhabitable.

Major.name: High Conspiracy
Major.tooltip: To knowingly work with another person in the interest of committing a major or greater crime.

Major.name: Hostile Activity
Major.tooltip: To knowingly commit an act which is in direct opposition to the interests of Nanotrasen, Or to directly assist a known enemy of the corporation.

Major.name: Possession, Illegal Inherently Dangerous Equipment
Major.tooltip: To possess restricted or illegal equipment which has a primary purpose of causing harm to others, or large amounts of destruction.

Major.name: Inciting a Riot
Major.tooltip: To perform actions in the interest of causing large amounts of unrest up to and including rioting.

Major.name: Manslaughter
Major.tooltip: To unintentionally kill someone through negligent, but not malicious, actions.

Major.name: Trespass, High Security Areas
Major.tooltip: Trespassing in any of the following without appropriate permission or access: Command areas, Personal offices, Weapons storage, weapon production, explosive storage, explosive production, or other high security areas.

Major.name: Breaking and Entering, High Security Areas
Major.tooltip: To commit trespassing into a secure area as defined in Code 309(Trespass, High Security Areas) using forcible entry.

Major.name: Dereliction
Major.tooltip: To willfully abandon an obligation that is critical to the station's continued operation.

Major.name: Corporate Fraud
Major.tooltip: To misrepresent one's intention in the interest of gaining property or money from Nanotrasen, or to gain or give property or money from Nanotrasen without proper authorization.

Major.name: Identity Theft
Major.tooltip: To assume the identity of another individual.

Capital.name: Prime Murder
Capital.tooltip: To commit the act of murder, with clear intent to kill, and clear intent or to have materially take steps to prevent the revival of the victim

Capital.name: Grand Larceny
Capital.tooltip: To steal inherently dangerous items from their storage, one's person, or other such methods acquire through illicit means.

Capital.name: Grand Sabotage
Capital.tooltip: To destroy or modify station assets or equipment without which the station may collapse or otherwise become uninhabitable.

Capital.name: Espionage
Capital.tooltip: To knowingly betray critical information to enemies of the station.

Capital.name: Enemy of the Corporation
Capital.tooltip: To be a member of any of the following organizations: Hostile boarding parties, Wizards, Changeling Hiveminds, cults.

Capital.name: Possession, Corporate Secrets
Capital.tooltip: To possess secret documentation or high density tamper-resistant data storage devices (Blackboxes) from any organization without authorization by Nanotrasen.

Capital.name: Subversion of the Chain of Command
Capital.tooltip: Disrupting the chain of command via either murder of a commanding officer or illegaly declaring oneself to be a commanding officer.

Capital.name: Biological Terror
Capital.tooltip: To knowingly release, cause, or otherwise cause the station to become affected by a disease, plant, or other biological form which may spread uncontained and or cause serious physical harm.
